byline.contributor: Vindu Goel contributed reporting from San Francisco.
byline.original: By MARK SCOTT and JAMES KANTER

abstract: European Commission is expected to bring antitrust charges against Google, accusing it of using its 90 percent search market share to favor its own services over others; case would be largest of its kind since that against Microsoft, and could present Google with an enormous fine and prospect of shifting its business practices on the Continent.
lead_paragraph: Europe’s antitrust chief is expected to accuse the search giant of using its dominant position to favor its own services, a case that could force a change in its practices.

headline.main: Google Expected to Face Antitrust Charges in Europe
headline.print_headline: Europe Is Said to Be Set to Charge Google in Antitrust Case

snippet: Europe’s antitrust chief is expected to accuse the search giant of using its dominant position to favor its own services, a case that could force a change in its practices.
